subdisciplines.name: Behavioral Economics
subdisciplines.description: The study of how psychology affects economic decision-making and behavior.

subdisciplines.name: Industrial Organization
subdisciplines.description: The study of how firms compete in a market and the implications for market structure and outcomes.

subdisciplines.name: Game Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of strategic interaction among rational agents, including individuals, firms, and governments.

subdisciplines.name: Information Economics
subdisciplines.description: The study of how information is used and communicated in economic systems.
